original_solution_mapping.L1: If one meatball is made from 1/8 pound of hamburger meat, then 4 pounds of hamburger meat will make 4/(1/8)=4*8=<<4/(1/8)=32>>32 meatballs.
original_solution_mapping.L2: 32 meatballs divided amongst 8 family members is 32/8=<<32/8=4>>4 meatballs per family member.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 842.
    Returns: the number of meatballs Antonio will eat.
    """
    # L1
    hamburger_per_meatball = Fraction(1, 8) # 1/8 of a pound of hamburger per meatball
    total_hamburger = 4 # 4 pounds of hamburger
    reciprocal_of_hamburger_per_meatball = 8 # WK (reciprocal of 1/8)
    total_meatballs = total_hamburger / hamburger_per_meatball

    # L2
    num_family_members = 8 # 8 family members
    meatballs_per_person = total_meatballs / num_family_members

    # FA
    answer = meatballs_per_person
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If one meatball is made from {hamburger_per_meatball} pound of hamburger meat, then {total_hamburger} pounds of hamburger meat will make {total_hamburger}/({hamburger_per_meatball})={total_hamburger}*{reciprocal_of_hamburger_per_meatball}=<<{total_hamburger}/({hamburger_per_meatball})={total_meatballs}>>{total_meatballs} meatballs.

{total_meatballs} meatballs divided amongst {num_family_members} family members is {total_meatballs}/{num_family_members}=<<{total_meatballs}/{num_family_members}={meatballs_per_person}>>{meatballs_per_person} meatballs per family member.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If one meatball is made from 4 pound of hamburger meat, then 4 pounds of hamburger meat will make 4/(4)=4*8=<<4/(4)=1>>1 meatballs.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 1 meatballs divided amongst 8 family members is 1/8=<<1/8=0.12>>0.12 meatballs per family member.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_hamburger' (4) was used instead of 'hamburger_per_meatball' (1/8).
